<a id="StaticBody3D"></a>

# StaticBody3D

**Inherits:** [PhysicsBody3D](PhysicsBody3D.md) **\<** [CollisionObject3D](CollisionObject3D.md) **\<** [Node3D](Node3D.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [AnimatableBody3D](AnimatableBody3D.md)

A 3D physics body that can't be moved by external forces. When moved manually, it doesn't affect other bodies in its path.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A static 3D physics body. It can't be moved by external forces or contacts, but can be moved manually by other means such as code, [AnimationMixer](AnimationMixer.md)\\ s (with [AnimationMixer.callback_mode_process](AnimationMixer.md#AnimationMixer_property_callback_mode_process) set to [AnimationMixer.ANIMATION_CALLBACK_MODE_PROCESS_PHYSICS](AnimationMixer.md#AnimationMixer_constant_ANIMATION_CALLBACK_MODE_PROCESS_PHYSICS)), and [RemoteTransform3D](RemoteTransform3D.md).

When **StaticBody3D** is moved, it is teleported to its new position without affecting other physics bodies in its path. If this is not desired, use [AnimatableBody3D](AnimatableBody3D.md) instead.

\ **StaticBody3D** is useful for completely static objects like floors and walls, as well as moving surfaces like conveyor belts and circular revolving platforms (by using [constant_linear_velocity](StaticBody3D.md#StaticBody3D_property_constant_linear_velocity) and [constant_angular_velocity](StaticBody3D.md#StaticBody3D_property_constant_angular_velocity)).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="StaticBody3D_property_constant_angular_velocity"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector3](Vector3.md) **constant_angular_velocity** = `Vector3(0, 0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#StaticBody3D_property_constant_angular_velocity)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_constant_angular_velocity**\ (\ value\: [Vector3](Vector3.md)\ )
- [Vector3](Vector3.md) **get_constant_angular_velocity**\ (\ )

The body's constant angular velocity. This does not rotate the body, but affects touching bodies, as if it were rotating.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="StaticBody3D_property_constant_linear_velocity"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector3](Vector3.md) **constant_linear_velocity** = `Vector3(0, 0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#StaticBody3D_property_constant_linear_velocity)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_constant_linear_velocity**\ (\ value\: [Vector3](Vector3.md)\ )
- [Vector3](Vector3.md) **get_constant_linear_velocity**\ (\ )

The body's constant linear velocity. This does not move the body, but affects touching bodies, as if it were moving.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="StaticBody3D_property_physics_material_override"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[PhysicsMaterial](PhysicsMaterial.md) **physics_material_override** [ðŸ”—](#StaticBody3D_property_physics_material_override)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_physics_material_override**\ (\ value\: [PhysicsMaterial](PhysicsMaterial.md)\ )
- [PhysicsMaterial](PhysicsMaterial.md) **get_physics_material_override**\ (\ )

The physics material override for the body.

If a material is assigned to this property, it will be used instead of any other physics material, such as an inherited one.
